CWEs: CWE-79: Improper Neutralization of Input During Web Page Generation ('Cross-site Scripting')
description: The function is vulnerable to Cross-Site Scripting (XSS) attacks. This is due to the use of innerHTML property which allows the execution of arbitrary JavaScript code. An attacker can inject malicious scripts through the 'row' variable that is directly used to set the innerHTML of a div element. This can lead to various attacks such as stealing sensitive information, session hijacking, defacement of the website, etc.
